alert.note: Alert for Addison; Caledonia; Orange; Rutland; Washington; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 7:26PM EST until February 19 at 8:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... East central Essex County in northern New York... South central Caledonia County in northeastern Vermont... Orange County in central Vermont... Addison County in central Vermont... Northeastern Rutland County in southern Vermont... Northwestern Windsor County in southern Vermont... Southern Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 815 PM EST. * At 725 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Orange to Warren to Moore Point, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 24 and 49. Interstate 91 between mile markers 89 and 110. Locations impacted include... Barre, Middlebury, Cornwall, Braintree Hill, Bradford, Weybridge, Orange, Salisbury, Websterville, Lincoln, Whiting, New Haven, Granville, Fairlee, Addison, Tunbridge, Hancock, Corinth Corners, Washington and Ripton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Addison; Caledonia; Orange; Rutland; Washington; Windsor
